snippet: The problems with Apple’s new mobile maps were embarrassing, but the company has a tendency to bungle services that rely heavily on the Internet.
abstract: Apple apologizes to iPhone customers for its new mobile maps, which often direct users to nonsensical routes and misplaced landmarks; remarkably suggests users try map services from rivals like Microsoft and Google while it works on fixes; incident shows users' reliance on map services and highlights Apple's tendency to bungle services that rely heavily on the Internet.

headline.main: Apple Apologizes for Misstep on Maps
headline.print_headline: Apple Apologizes for Misstep on Maps

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and BRIAN X. CHEN

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes a startup that failed to live up to its hype after raising $41 million, a snappy new YouTube show that reviews a...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Friday's selection includes a startup that failed to live up to its hype after raising $41 million, a snappy new YouTube show that reviews apps and an argument that patents should be abolished because they eventually stifle innovation.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Rethinking Patents, and Too Much Money

snippet: Apple’s plans for an Internet radio service have hit a snag over the licensing of music controlled by Sony/ATV, which recently became the world’s biggest music publisher.
abstract: Apple’s plans for an Internet radio service have hit a snag over the licensing of music controlled by Sony/ATV, which recently became the world’s biggest music publisher.

headline.main: Apple's Plans for Internet Radio Run Up Against Big Music Publisher
headline.print_headline: Apple Web Radio Plans Stall Over Music Rights From Sony/ATV

snippet: Whatever the story, the Apple chief's apology for the condition of the new maps app conveys a note of humility that has been missing so far. Without it, the Apple Maps fiasco felt even worse than it was.
abstract: Whatever the story, the Apple chief's apology for the condition of the new maps app conveys a note of humility that has been missing so far. Without it, the Apple Maps fiasco felt even worse than it was.

headline.main: Tim Cook's Apology Is an Important Step Forward

snippet: Apple’s map application debacle has been a boon for MapQuest, which had been eclipsed in the era of in-car GPS and smartphones.
abstract: Apple’s map application debacle has been a boon for MapQuest, which had been eclipsed in the era of in-car GPS and smartphones.

headline.main: As Apple's Maps Stumbles, AOL's MapQuest Flourishes

snippet: Shopping for a receiver was once a simple matter, but now there are new considerations, like connectivity and the ability to upgrade software.
abstract: Shopping for a receiver was once a simple matter, but now there are new considerations, like connectivity and the ability to upgrade software.

snippet: Investors pushed up the beleaguered BlackBerry maker’s share price on Friday almost 7 percent after a quarterly financial report that, while loss ridden, was not as bad as feared.
abstract: Investors pushed up the beleaguered BlackBerry maker’s share price on Friday almost 7 percent after a quarterly financial report that, while loss ridden, was not as bad as feared.

headline.main: Some Analysts Start to Like RIM

snippet: "Putting up" just-past-ripe berries and stone fruits in summer, and cooking apple and pumpkin butters all day over a low flame in fall, allows me to reach back to tradition and bond with my daughter, neighbors and friends.
abstract: "Putting up" just-past-ripe berries and stone fruits in summer, and cooking apple and pumpkin butters all day over a low flame in fall, allows me to reach back to tradition and bond with my daughter, neighbors and friends.

snippet: British regulators finally have a plan for fixing Libor, but it remains to be seen whether it will work. | The Greek government is on an overseas treasure hunt. | Heineken finally claimed victory in its effort to buy Asia Pacific Breweries. | Trea...
abstract: British regulators finally have a plan for fixing Libor, but it remains to be seen whether it will work. | The Greek government is on an overseas treasure hunt. | Heineken finally claimed victory in its effort to buy Asia Pacific Breweries. | Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner called for the Financial Stability Oversight Council to push ahead on new rules for money market funds.

headline.main: A New and Improved Libor, Maybe

snippet: Complaints and jokes about Apple’s new maps have not stopped since the company released iOS 6 last week, a software update that replaced Google’s maps with its own.
abstract: Complaints and jokes about Apple’s new maps have not stopped since the company released iOS 6 last week, a software update that replaced Google’s maps with its own.

headline.main: Tim Cook Apologizes for Apple's Maps
